question: A scientist wants to produce virus-free plant in tissue culture. Which part of the plant will he use as an explant?
(a) Mature stem
(b) Axillary meristem
(c) Apical meristem
(d) Mesophyll cells
explanation: The meristems (apical and axillary) are free of virus even in infected plants because the cells divide faster than the virus spreads. Therefore, meristems are used to recover virus-free plants.
